fields.summary: Autocomplete doesn't work when tagging users in Snippet comments

fields.description:
I make use of the three filters to hide pull requests with (My Approval, Open Tasks, Broken Builds)

These are definitely useful as a dev manager with visibility to many pull requests. One other filter that would be nice is an option to hide PRs that are "Unwatched" and perhaps make it checked by default. If someone has explicitly "unwatched" a pull request (unsubscribing from emails), it's likely the case that it shouldn't show up in the dashboard list. Adding approval without giving a full thoughtful review just to get the PR to disappear as an action item on the dashboard is not a good behavior.

I believe this would mirror some nice functionality in GitHub (especially relevant for organization owning members) where the notifications dashboard shows all pull requests for the entire org (since the owner can see all of them), and the unsubscribe action can mark them as PRs that are handled autonomously by a team.

thanks,\\
andrew
fields.summary: Add filter to hide pull requests that are not being watched

fields.description:
We would like to post "status updates" from pipelines to both pull requests and the deployment screen.

For a pull request, this could be something like how some metric is changed by the PR, or our infrastructure-as-code use case of calculating the diff with current running systems.\\
These status updates would hopefully be shown above the comments section, and would be updated on every pipeline run.\\
It would be sufficient if it could just capture the output of a specific step in the pipeline and post it verbatim.

For deployments, we'd like a similar mechanism that could replace/augument the diff screen shown before promoting a build.\\
We currently run a pipeline step between our deployments that calculates the changes that will be made by running the deploy, but this requires some back-and-forth between screens. Having a new tab alongside commits/issues/diffs would be perfect.
fields.summary: Display custom information as tab in Deployments preview and summary

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce

* create a repository
* commit a change where thousands of files are added
* push it
* go to bitbucket.org, go to that repository
* click on the commit where thousands of files were added

Expected:\\
should be able to instantly open the page describing the commit, regardless of how many changes it contains. If there is too much data to display in a single page, f***ing paginate it!

Observed:\\
After about 30 seconds or so, an error shows up: "That page timed out while trying to load".

F***ing pathetic.
fields.summary: Unable to open a commit with "too" many changes

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

* make sure you are not logged in
* go to a project's issue tracker so as to report a new bug (or anywhere for that matter), e.g.\\
https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/issues/new
* click on the "log in" link that is usually everywhere. For example, if you were to report a bug, it says "You may want to log in [...] before creating an issue", so click there to do precisely that
* enter your login credentials

Expected:\\
after succesful login, it should redirect to the page where you were when you clicked on "log in".

Observed:\\
after succesfully logging in, you are redirected to the freaking dashboard, and lose track of where you were. I hate websites that redirect you to some fixed url after logging in instead of redirecting you back to where you were. It should be punished with death. It's especially annoying when you are explicitly encouraged to log in before you "continue" doing something, but it's annoying and wrong also in every other case, unless there's a very good reason for not being able to figure out where the user came from before login, or for not being able to redirect them there.
fields.summary: Login redirects to dashboard instead of the page you were in

fields.description:
Hi,

One of my repositories bugged out, it's not a breaking bug, but is really weird. There is a ghost file that I cannot delete nor pull from the repository, and only apears in the webclient.

----
!3445803445-1.png|thumbnail!

----
!306186932-2.png|thumbnail!

The file was deleted in Intellij IDEA and later when I checked if the push was successful, there was a file with no commit and size, like is shown in the images. I tried to fix it by deleting both the project and the respository, wich I did 2 times, and setting them up again (*with the same names*), but the ghost file remained in the repository.

Then I uploaded the project to a repository *with another name*, and there was no ghost file.

My conclusion is, there is some cache or space asigned to the name of the repository I'am trying to use, and it got corrupted.
fields.summary: Ghost file

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Repository's Wiki page were unable to clone using HTTPS connection.\\
However, it works using an SSH connection.

Steps to Reproduce:

# Go to your repository >> Wiki
# Click "Clone wiki" button on the right side >> Choose "HTTPS"

*HTTPS*:

{code}
#!GIT

$ git clone https://username@bitbucket.org/username/repo_name.git/wiki 
Cloning into 'wiki'... 
remote: Repository not found 
fatal: repository 'https://username@bitbucket.org/username/repo_name.git/wiki/' not found
{code}

*SSH*:

{code}
#!GIT

$ git clone git@bitbucket.org:username/repo_name.git/wiki 
Cloning into 'wiki'... remote: Counting objects: 6, done. 
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (4/4), done. 
remote: Total 6 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0) 
Receiving objects: 100% (6/6), done.
{code}

h3. *Expected Result*
Clone repository's Wiki via HTTPS connection

h3. *Actual Result*
Cannot clone repository's Wiki via HTTPS connection

h3. *Workaround*
Use SSH connection for now

{code}
#!GIT
git clone git@bitbucket.org:username/repo_name.git/wiki
{code}
fields.summary: Repository Wiki clone not working using HTTPS connection

fields.description:
continuation of BCLOUD-7396

When will this finally get resolved?

# We cannot reuse ANY documentation written elsewhere, because Bitbucket is the only party that does not respect line breaks in text. Similarly, any documentation written with Bitbucket's poor Markdown implementation is completely rubbish outside Bitbucket.
# The current implementation of "two spaces make a line break" is unworkable. These extra spaces will break (for example) bash multiline code snippets.
# Any IDE with a Markdown preview is useless, because the preview does not reflect Bitbucket's faulty Markdown rendering.
fields.summary: Markdown parsing of text editor is still losing line breaks

fields.description:
I added a file to the repo (master branch) - the 'source' webview shows the file, but when I click on it to view it (it's a markdown file) bitbucket says the file is _not found_. If I make a clean clone of the repo to my computer - the file is there.

My question: *Why does bitbucket say the file is missing?*

3 attached images...

# file-shown-in-source-view.PNG shows the file is there (apparently) in the master branch.
# file-not-found-when-i-click-on-it.PNG but when I click on the file to view it (from the source view) the file is not found
# can-view-file-when-i-click-thru-from-commit-listing.PNG but if I go to the commits view, I see the file in the commits listing. From there I can view the file
fields.summary: bitbucket says file not found in repo - but clean clone of repo contains file (all master branch)

fields.description:
* Have a pipeline setup for a project. It should trigger on each commit.
* Create a PR. Open it. (Optionally tick "Close branch after merge").
* Click "Merge".\\
Expected: The icon on the top right (see screenshot) is showing "Build in progress" icon. It should show merge commit build status.\\
Actual: It shows last commit build status for a branch which no longer exists.

GitHub is smart here. It shows merge commit build status.\\
Bitbucket shows irrelevant data.

*Since Pipelines implemented the "Deployments" feature I believe this is a critical bug to fix. We need to know if this PR is responsible for a build failure, or the software was released fine.*

!246702968-wrong-build-shown-after-merge.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Wrong build is shown after PR is merged

fields.description:
So I'm trying to automatically publish my package to NPM on merges into {{master}} of my repo. When creating a Pipelines YML, one can find a link to an NPM guide [here|https://npme.npmjs.com/docs/tutorials/pipelines.html], that gives an example of how to set up auth using an NPM token in pipelines. It doesn't seem to work, however, and I get the following error in the output when trying to {{npm publish}}:

{code}
npm ERR! code ENEEDAUTH
npm ERR! need auth auth required for publishing
npm ERR! need auth You need to authorize this machine using `npm adduser`
{code}

The script looks like this:

{code}
pipelines:
  default:
    ...
  branches:
    master:
      - step:
          name: Build, test, bump version, tag commit and publish
          caches: 
            - node
          script:
            - yarn
            - yarn build
            - yarn test
            - git init
            - git config user.email "my@email.com"
            - git config user.name "My Name"
            - git config push.default simple
            - git remote set-url origin ssh://git@bitbucket.org/${BITBUCKET_REPO_OWNER}/${BITBUCKET_REPO_SLUG}.git
            - printf "//`node -p \"require('url').parse(process.env.NPM_REGISTRY_URL || 'https://registry.npmjs.org').host\"`/:_authToken=${NPM_TOKEN}\nregistry=${NPM_REGISTRY_URL:-https://registry.npmjs.org}\n" >> ~/.npmrc
            - yarn versionbump:patch
            - git show-ref
            - git push --follow-tags
            - yarn npmpublish
{code}

----
And my {{scripts}} in {{package.json}}:

{code}
"npmpublish": "npm publish",
"versionbump:patch": "npm version patch -m '[skip CI] Update to %s'",
{code}

I've set {{NPM_TOKEN}} in the repo env vars, gotten it from www.npmjs.com -> profile -> tokens

*Everything works fine up until* {{publish}} which fails with the error mentioned above

I then tried using [this tool|https://github.com/bahmutov/ci-publish#readme] to publish instead *while keeping the {{printf ...}} command*, and then the error said that an auth token was already set when {{ci-publish}} was trying to set auth. Unfortunately, removing the {{printf}} command and using ci-publish fails with the exact same error, saying auth is needed.

*How do I auth the NPM CLI in Bitbucket Pipelines?*

Thanks :-)
fields.summary: NPM integration doesn't work

fields.description:
This is a bug report about a minor detail in the account settings dialog of SourceTree, where the save button is deactivated when actually needed.

Environment:\\
Mac OS X 10.13.6\\
SourceTree 2.7.6

What I did:

# I create my account details in SourceTree. An old ssh key, [name]-Bitucket.pub, was automatically recognized.
# I deleted that automatically recognized ssh key and all bitbucket-related savings in known-hosts, config, etc.
# I went back to my account settings in Bitbucket, which now shows a warning triangle, because there is no ssh key found. (I call this, for the sake of reference, "pop-up window 1")
# I click on "Create SSH key" (or whatever that button is called): a new window is opened - "pop-up window 2" - and offers to enter a password phrase. I enter the password phrase and click close. The "pop-up window 2" closes.

What I would expect:

Being back in pop-up window 1, I now expect to be able to click the save button in order to save my new settings.

What really happens:

The "Save" button is disabled, only cancel is possible.

Remark:

Since the SSH key was created and saved in the step with "pop-up window 2", and SourceTree recognized a generated SSH key automatically, it might be correct that my expectations of having an active save button available now - after adding an ssh key - are wrong, because everything is indeed saved as a click on "Cancel" and a re-opening of the account settings proves. However, it is misleading, since I just added a new configuration - the ssh key - to my settings...
fields.summary: Creating ssh key via sourceTree deactivates Save button

fields.description:
Hello Team,

Let's say I have a Branch1 and child Branch2, and I want to create a new PullRequest from Branch2-->Branch1. This is what I usually do:

# Push my local Branch2 changes
# Open https://bitbucket.org/.../pull-requests/new
# Check that source branch dropdown shows my Branch2 (it is usually has a correct selected value as I do steps 1-3 together).
# Change target branch dropdown from {{master}} to Branch1
# Click {{Create pull request}} button

I want to ask you to help me with step BCLOUD-4, and pre-populate it the {{direct parent of the source branch}}, which is Branch1 (not {{master}}) in my case.

Thanks in advance

--\\
Sergiy

fields.description:
Hello

I would love to see a bitbucket pipelines agent provided, similar to the gitlab-runner go agent, which users could run on-prem, or inside secure networks.

The agent would register with the cloud, and we could specify which agent(s) pipelines could run against.  When the agent runs, it polls the cloud for jobs to process.

Note that this would remove the need to provide support for BCLOUD-12753.

Thanks
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines agent for on-prem pipeline actions

fields.description:
Hello!

I'm the author and maintainer of the [Refined Bitbucket|https://github.com/refined-bitbucket/refined-bitbucket] browser extension, which for one of its features it's hitting the endpoint mentioned in the title and relying on the {{.size}} property to show a badge with the number of open branches in the sidebar.

!2813031970-sidebar.PNG|thumbnail!

About three days ago, the feature broke because the {{.size}} property is not being returned anymore. I checked the documentation in the link below and the property is still documented, which leads me to believe that maybe this was a mistake?

[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/refs/branches|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/refs/branches]

Also, as you can see from the picture, the {{pull-requests}}  API endpoint which has a similarly-shaped response wasn't affected.

Can anyone confirm what happened here? I have about 4,500+ active users in the extension that are seeing this bug at the moment and I would prefer not to have to rollback the feature :(

Reference: https://github.com/refined-bitbucket/refined-bitbucket/issues/240
fields.summary: Property `size` missing in `/2.0/repositories/{team}/{repo}/refs/branches` API response

The integration at the repo should be linked to the Trello account and not the Trello board.

Please fix this asap.

Thanks!

fields.description:
Related to BCLOUD-16990, we have a repo that went over 2G.

And now force pushing on a branch and removing a commit to trigger a repo pruning takes ages to be effective. I've done it earlier today and we're almost 10hours after if I recall the correct time, and the repo still shows as 2.1G on your settings page, while it should be at 1.1. So we are stuck.
fields.summary: Force pruning the git repository takes ages to be effective

fields.description:
We have a repo that is about 1.1G.

( We will clean its history in the near future, but not right now as we are in the middle of a major release).

It has happened several times that it goes above 2G and we get stuck.

Yet we monitor the size on the settings page and it doesn't show an increase until too late. For example, I monitored the page this week everyday and the repo size was said to be 1.1G. Yet today it just bumped to 2.1G.

We have only committed code changes, not assets. So I believe there's an issue in the reporting of the repository size. It doesn't update itself properly.

There's an issue with the pruning as well, which I reported as BCLOUD-16991
fields.summary: Repository size doesn't seem to update properly

fields.description: The file history API follows file renames by default. If git reports the file as copied, Bitbucket returns a 500. As a temporary work around, calling this api with {{renames=false}} will return the file history up until the point of a rename or copy and will successfully return.
fields.summary: File history API returns a 500 for files that are considered copied by git

fields.description: Hmm... can't find that one
fields.summary: Hmm... can't find that one

fields.description:
I wanted to rename a file, so I did:

git mv test_web_tls_all.py test_admin_web_tls_protocols.py

I've successfully committed this change, but this file didn't get removed nor renamed, it's still there even after deleting it, a new file wasn't added and doesn't displayed in the source view anymore, although when cloning this branch it appears to be present.

Any new file I'm adding to bitbucket now, is not listed and not displayed at all, but when cloning the repository it's present.

!3205256164-bitbucked_rename.png|thumbnail!\\
!2918826972-bitbucked_rename2.png|thumbnail!

!1026528022-bitbucked_rename3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: After renaming file (git mv) old file is not updated, becomes empty and impossible to remve, new file didn't added

fields.description:
Our team uses VSTS to build and deploy. One of the steps we use is "Get Sources" in which we authenticated our VSTS project (& all builds) to Bitbucket Cloud via OAuth.

Environments:\\
Hosted Ubuntu 16.04\\
Hosted MS

Our last successful fetch/clone was on August 13th @ 2:51 EDT

Note: We unfortunately do not have a way to modify the VSTS task "Get Sources". We can of course turn off this step and write our own SSH task to clone. However, we would have to modify around 25 builds.

Here is the VSTS script that is run to clone the repository:

{code:bash}
git init
git remote add origin https://bitbucket.org//project/srsv3_frontend
git config gc.auto 0
git config --get-all http.https://bitbucket.org//project/repo_name.extraheader
git config --get-all http.proxy

# git command that causes the error:
git -c http.extraheader="AUTHORIZATION: basic ***" fetch --tags --prune --progress --no-recurse-submodules --depth=1 origin
{code}

Error message:

{code:bash}
Git fetch failed with exit code 128
fatal: could not read Username for 'https://bitbucket.org': terminal prompts disabled
{code}
fields.summary: VSTS OAuth Connection: git fetch - fatal error

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Resource Owner Password Credentials Grant (4.3) has stopped working this month.\\
https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/oauth-2/

Steps to reproduce:

{code}
#!CURL

$ curl -X POST -u "client_id:secret" \
       https://bitbucket.org/site/oauth2/access_token -d grant_type=password \
       -d username=my_username -d password=my_password
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100   168  100    93  100    75     50     40  0:00:01  0:00:01 --:--:--    90{"error_description": "Invalid resource owner username/password", "error": "invalid_request"}
{code}

h3. *Expected Results*
Password Credentials Grant Rest API should be working

h3. *Actual Results*
Password Credentials Grant Rest API stopped working

h3. *Workaround*
Use an App password as authentication for API calls.\\
*For example:*

{code}
#!CURL

CURL https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/username/repository_name -u usename:YOUR_APP_PASSWORD
{code}
fields.summary: OAuth 2.0 API Password Credentials Grant stopped working
OAuth 2.0 - Resource Owner Password Credentials Grant Fails

fields.description:
Hi,

We are using Bitbucket both as our git repository and for integration with Jenkins while building our product.

In the last few days we have been experiencing significant slowness in  our interfaces with Bitbucket. We have to wait a very long time for cloning our repositories and committing our code.\\
Moreover, our Jenkins build are failing on timeouts because they are waiting enlessly for Bitbucket.

**This is a very urgent issue for us, we will appreciate you help as soon as possible.\\
**\\
Thanks,\\
Tal
fields.summary: Slowness and timeout when working with Bitbucket cloud

fields.description:
This is my markdown:

{code}
### Migrations workflow in feature branches:
Before merging into master do the following:
1. Delete your migration
2. Checkout and update master
3. Checkout your branch and rebase with master
4. Recreate your migration
5. Merge into master
{code}

And this is the result:

fields.description:
As per the title, today it's not possible to authenticate with OAuth using a token to access the SSH endpoints.

There is definitely some security handling that needs to be done to implement this in the future, however it should be possible nevertheless, just as it is when using app passwords.
fields.summary: OAuth authentication methods are blocked on SSH endpoints.

fields.description:
When creating a PR on Bitbucket you would while on a fork, the default reviewers of this PR will be the same ones as the users which are the default reviewers of the base repo.

For example:\\
Repo lllllfork is a for of lllll\\
Gabriel is the default reviewer of lllll:\\
!1581763569-Screen%20Shot%202018-08-15%20at%2015.23.59.png|thumbnail!

Cassiano is the default reviewer for lllllfork:\\
!353381931-Screen%20Shot%202018-08-15%20at%2015.23.47.png|thumbnail!

If I attempt to create a PR for lllllfork, Gabriel will be my default reviewer and Bitbucket will ignore the fact that Cassiano is the default reviewer:\\
!2310060047-Screen%20Shot%202018-08-15%20at%2015.23.36.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Default reviewers for fork repositories come from the base repo instead of the fork

fields.description:
According to https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/search-873876782.html Bitbucket Cloud's code search only indexes files smaller than 320 KB.

This makes searching larger files impossible on a larger scale project, so I think a sweet spot for code search indexing would be somewhere around 1MB, which is the usual file size for a pretty large code file.
fields.summary: Remove/Raise the size limitation for code search

fields.description: Would be good to have an feature which allows to directly paste images on editor (or other editor there), like we have in Jira.
fields.summary: Copy & Paste images on Issues

fields.description:
Got a project set up in Eclipse, feeding into Bitbucket through eGit.  Been going for 6+ months now.

Pushed a commit in this morning on machine 1. Worked fine.\\
Pulled it down on machine 2. Worked fine.\\
Updated some code on machine 2.\\
Pushed a commit up - and it failed.

It was failing with a 405 Service Not Allowed, but after rebooting my machine it's not failing with a service=git-receive-pack not found.

I'm assuming this is your end as I've not changed anything my end...
fields.summary: Problems committing a code update - 405, git-receive-pack not found

fields.description:
If you have a folder with the same name than the repository, it shows a hash string and denies access to the files inside the folder.

If you rename the repository or the folder, the problem dissapear.

Allow sort repository by

https://bitbucket.org/borsanza/phpmoko.gallery

I am waiting more than 24 hours...

It seems that this error is very recurrent...
fields.summary: Please wait a moment while we create your repository.

fields.description:
I used the web GUI to rename two files, but both old filenames still appear.  For example, I renamed {{setup-090-download-from-bitbucket.sh}} to {{setup-090-download-from-bitbucket-and-seed.sh}}, but only {{setup-090-download-from-bitbucket.sh}} appears.  There are commit values for both rename commands.

I have tried logging out and back in, and refreshing the page.  I only have a master branch.\\
It has been 40-50 minutes since I renamed the files (41 minutes ago for the first file, 50 minutes ago for the second file).  When I click on {{setup-090-download-from-bitbucket.sh}} to edit the file, the editor just spins.
fields.summary: Renamed files don't appear with new names

fields.description:
As an admin, I would like to to enforce that commits to our repositories have an author email address with a specific domain name.

This is necessary for cases where clients have different repositories for different clients, and it is needed to switch the email that is associated with the commit to match the one associated with the client, in order to prevent a bad commit from ending up in the repository.

At this moment is is only possible to create a client side hook.
fields.summary: Enforce email address domain on commit
Wrong response error message from Bitbucket API when using OAuth

fields.description:
Hi,\\
There is an issue with the French translation of 'User groups' in the Account administration.\\
The proper translation should be "Groupes d'utilisateurs", but currently reads "Goupes d'utilisateurs". Notice the missing 'r' in the first word.\\
The issue occurs both is the left menu, and - when selecting it - as the title of the page.\\
See attached screenshot, both highlighted in yellow.
fields.summary: Incorrect french translation of "User groups"

fields.description:
I find that I am unable to add reviewers to pull requests on  my repo.  When I type in the names of users who exist and are on this repo, nothing happens--their usernames do not fill in.  And if I type in their whole username myself, it says they don't exist even though they do.

Same problem happens when trying to add default reviewers.
fields.summary: Cannot add reviewers to pull requests

fields.description:
Cloud

We want to restrict Repo creation so that the Access Level can only be Private.\\
Is this possible?
fields.summary: Private only Access Level for new Repos possible?  (i.e. NOT Public)

fields.description:
Hi

i think it would be usefull to have two additional "Default Environment Variables". BITBUCKET_USER_FULLNAME, BITBUCKET_USER_EMAIL from the logged in user profile. They could be used to identify the user in the pipelines. Like

* git config --global user.email $BITBUCKET_USER_EMAIL
* git config --global user.name $BITBUCKET_USER_FULLNAME

Thanks
fields.summary: additional Default Environment Variables

fields.description: The committer's email is saved in commits and, for the public repositories, the email is revealed to anyone on the Internet. To increase users' privacy, implement a substitution of the original email by a personalized no-reply email, e.g., bob@users.noreply.bitbucket.org. This way, the commits can be still associated with their author, but the user's email will not be revealed.
fields.summary: Implement commiter email privacy

fields.description:
A method, either programmatically or by manipulating settings, a way to automatically trigger a pipeline rerun.

More specifically:

* ability to specify whether to rerun the entire pipeline or just the failed steps
* ability to specify the number of attempts being automatically triggered
* ability to specify a time gap between reattempts

Our team uses pipelines a ton, and since its release, we frequently use rerun pipeline steps as a standard practice while diagnosing failures. Having a solution like the one mentioned above would save us a significant amount of time.
fields.summary: automatically trigger pipeline rerun (entire pipeline or just failed steps)

fields.summary: Blank screen happen on history dropdown

fields.description:
Currently, when viewing code on web browser, the tab name shows "group_name / repo name / filename", and most of the time filename is not shown because tab width is not wide enough.

When I have multiple tabs open to browse multiple files, often I have to clicked through each tab to find the right tab I'm looking for.

I think it would be much easier to navigate if tab name is just the filename.

Hope that made sense.
fields.summary: Browser Tab name to reflect filename that is being viewed.

fields.description:
There may be some cases where we actually want the first step of the default pipelines config to be manually triggered.\\
Currently this is not allowed and we are forced to put in a dummy script step followed by the manually triggered step to actually do something.
fields.summary: Allow first step of pipelines to be manual
